body_html:
It is very helpful! Thanks.

But for the quick goal of getting things out of the way in the user model but not growing the already huge ApplicationForm object, this is the first solution that comes to my mind.

I realise I am thinking ahead, and maybe overthinking it. Because: it turns out we do have an application_form_helper. How about I put it just in there?

The reason I am not (yet) wildly enthousiastic about the forms/ directory, is because we do have the application_draft as well. (Which has its own namespace already.) And is also tightly related to the application_form.
I also looked at presenters, but that looks like overengineering for the current simple goal.

So, although I do not like helpers at all, in this special case it might be serving the quick goal?
WDYT? Helper or module?

body:
It is very helpful! Thanks. 

> But for the quick goal of getting things out of the way in the user model but not growing the already huge ApplicationForm object, this is the first solution that comes to my mind.

I realise I am thinking ahead, and maybe overthinking it. Because: it turns out we do have an [application_form_helper](https://github.com/rails-girls-summer-of-code/rgsoc-teams/blob/master/app/helpers/application_form_helper.rb). How about I put it just in there?

The reason I am not (yet) wildly enthousiastic about the `forms/` directory, is because we do have the `application_draft` as well. (Which has its own namespace already.) And is also tightly related to the `application_form`.
I also looked at presenters, but that looks like overengineering for the current simple goal.

So, although I do not like helpers at all, in this special case it might be serving the quick goal?  
WDYT? Helper or module?
